channel.title: Which country would you fight for?
channel.description:
With all the patriotism and arguments about different countries on this forum, I thought this [i]might[/i] be a nice topic. But lets take a completely made up scenario, I'm not suggesting this could happen, I'm not asking for debate around who could do what, and all this, but purely:
If your country had been taken over or destroyed by another, doesn't matter which one, which other country, given the choice, would you then take alliance with? Which do you think would be worth helping to save other than your own?
This is more of a culture thing, what other countries do you think would be worth - potentially your life, saving? Politics is mostly out of the question, ignore what you think about the government and military power, think about the people and culture.
Give your reasons, too.

item.title: Which country would you fight for?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Mopman:

and the award for most obviously photoshopped picture 2010 goes to the daily mirror

I thought it wasnt photoshopped…

but seriously >mfw mirror.co.uk

Read full topic

item.title: Which country would you fight for?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:93, topic:363156”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=459419.msg3468481#msg3468481 date=1295118591]
heh, twisting statistics is only for you
[/quote]
Not really, even our unemployment statistic isn’t right. It doesn’t show you the people showing up for job interviews in flipflops and being late etc.

How do you measure happiness… You mean like riots in the UK and greece?

We could be like European countries if we wanted to in a heart beat.

And yet most of Europe is doing worse than us.

That depends. What area do you mean? Economy, health, happiness, etc…?

Mostly economy though, because when you give all your money to the other two you lose what you had in the first place.[/quote]https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/rankorder/2187rank.html

Did someone say economy?

Read full topic
item.source: Which country would you fight for?

item.title: Which country would you fight for?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Frell:

Oh I see, idiots still blaming her even though the criminal posted on gaming forums about how he hated politics, thought news was stupid, women always didn’t like him etc. She may be crazy but she wouldn’t pull anything like that.

Pull something like what? I just meant the fact that she’s clearly a mental inpatient escapee and for some reason you guys put her in a position of power and let her make a fool out of your country.

And, apparently, shape young minds.

Read full topic

item.title: Which country would you fight for?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

No, because like was already explained. The people who were breaking shit weren’t there protesting the student fees, they were, like at most large scale protests were using the cover of the crowds to get away with this.

All those people who were breaking shit either weren’t going to university, or would already be there and the student fees would mean little to them.

My point was happiness, they were obviously unhappy about something, all of them.

item.title: Which country would you fight for?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Yeah, but that isn’t a riot for any particular reason. And for your point to make sense, it would have to be.

Otherwise, your point is null and void.

item.title: Which country would you fight for?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Mopman:

you have no idea how much foreign media is baulking at the fact you let palin out in public

Oh I see, idiots still blaming her even though the criminal posted on gaming forums about how he hated politics, thought news was stupid, women always didn’t like him etc. She may be crazy but she wouldn’t pull anything like that.

Thug-life:

I have said it before, I’m happy to join in with these debates with you, but you do come out with some shit.

http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/politics/news/2010/12/10/students-on-rampage-after-uni-fees-vote-goes-through-115875-22773312/ The riots peace march only started peaceful

Our media warps shit here too, so I don’t doubt either of you guys. When you first said they werent riots I said to myself “oh, I guess not” But then I remembered some topic here a while back about fire or something.

R.I.P RSC:

Those ‘riots’ in the UK were merely a small group vandalizing shit, and provoking the cops. It tends to happen during protests, because some people believe that because they are part of a group, they can get away with it.

Sounds like at least a small scale riot to me.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

The student ones weren’t riots at all. A small percentage of the crowd decided to start breaking stuff.

That isn’t a riot. I had first hand experience of these protests, walking through them at manchester - and they certainly weren’t riots - not with the amount of school children being around there.

I have said it before, I’m happy to join in with these debates with you, but you do come out with some shit.
